bullets.text: Trump administration offers policy support to slow coal-plant closures, potentially raising power-sector emissions and complicating utilities’ transition economics.
Harvard and the Trump administration escalate a high-stakes dispute, signaling tighter federal scrutiny of elite universities and potential funding/regulatory leverage.
DOJ released more Epstein files and says over 1M additional potential records were newly uncovered, amplifying transparency, legal, and political risks.
Some DOJ redactions in Epstein documents are reportedly recoverable, exposing operational-security failures and increasing litigation and reputational fallout.
Honduras declares Nasry Asfura president; a Trump-aligned outcome may shift regional security, migration cooperation, and investment climate expectations.
Zelensky signals openness to pulling back troops in eastern Ukraine for a peace deal, implying possible de-escalation but contentious security guarantees.
Hundreds of Gazans reportedly killed despite a two-month truce, underscoring cease-fire fragility and elevated regional escalation and humanitarian risks.
Extended U.S. aircraft-carrier deployment in the Caribbean pressures Venezuela but raises fiscal and readiness costs, signaling sustained coercive diplomacy.
Nvidia is reportedly buying Groq assets for about $20B and licensing its tech, consolidating AI-chip IP and intensifying competition with hyperscalers.
Amazon faces a strategic choice: resist AI shopping agents that disintermediate storefronts or embrace them, reshaping e-commerce margins and advertising power.
BP plans to sell 65% of its $10B Castrol unit, highlighting portfolio reshaping and capital recycling amid energy-transition and oil-cycle uncertainty.
China’s dominance in critical minerals boosts Western rare-earth magnet makers short-term, but supply-chain security remains a key industrial-policy driver.
Scientists report reversing Alzheimer’s symptoms in mice and restoring memory, a promising mechanistic lead but far from validated human therapies.
Studies suggest AI boosts scientific paper output while average quality slips, raising concerns for research evaluation, peer review integrity, and funding allocation.
Research argues dietary choices materially influence climate and biodiversity outcomes, implying food-system policy and consumer behavior are major decarbonization levers.
